transcript.title: VISIT BY THE PRIME MINISTER OF JAPAN, MR RYUTARO HASHIMOTO
transcript.content:
VISIT BY THE PRIME MINISTER OF JAPAN,
MR RYUTARO HASHIMOTO
I have very great pleasure in announcing that the Prime Minister of Japan, Mr
Ryutaro Hashimoto, will visit Australia on 28-29 April. I look forward to
reciprocating the hospitality Mr Hashimoto extended to me during my visit to
Japan in September last year.
Mr Hashimoto's acceptance of my invitation reflects the importance we both attach
to maintaining the closest possible cooperation between us and our two countries.
Japan is a close friend of Australia's and a highly valued partner in regional and
international affairs. Japan is Australia's most important export market.
It is fitting that Mr Hashimoto should visit Australia in the year that we celebrate
the fortieth anniversary of the signing of the Australia-Japan Commerce
Agreement. This agreement opened the way for the development of a remarkable
economic relationship and laid the foundation for the present diverse and warm
relationship between our countries and peoples.
Mr Hashimoto's visit provides a welcome opportunity to discuss how we can best
promote our economic and political partnership and our cooperation in regional
affairs.
Mr Hashimoto will visit Canberra and Sydney.
